pageContext.description: Four narrow ribs on two wide face; edges of junction of mould still adhering especially larger piece above handle. Cutting edge damage; blue green patina.
pageContext.associations: Found in 1887 with Socketed Gouge (1887 No. 2944) and lump of copper or bronze (1887 No. 2945). The lump of copper or bronze (1887 No. 2945) seems to be part of a cake; 2 sides fairly smooth, all others rough & fall of air holes. Weight 1287.78 g.
pageContext.collection: Ashmolean Museum, Oxford,1887 No. 2943,Passed on by exchange, Dec. 1925 to The Municipal Museum, Hull
pageContext.site: England,Yorkshire (East Riding),Everthorpe,Everthorpe Hill, between North & South Cave.,1887
pageContext.toSearch: Everthorpe, Brough, East Riding Of Yorkshire Hu15, UK
